deleted_lines: context, instance, ordered_networks, nets, neutron, # We always need admin_client to build nw_info, # we sometimes need it when updating ports admin_client = get_client(context, admin=True)

subject: Unquote URL before using splited parts.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-21 22:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/s3api/test_s3token.py', 'swift/common/middleware/s3api/s3token.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/760efd1fe5cf913d692edb6e9c3e4f2b28130eb0', 'message': "Unquote URL before using splited parts.

Keystone EC2 access keys may contain URL reserved/unsafe chars,
then the access key in PATH_INFO can't be replace by account name.

ie.
  /v1/abc%3D/c/o  --> /v1/AUTH_PROJECT_ID/c/o

Change-Id: I034b0902f620cbb274647e24566dff2031beeae5
Closes-Bug: 1776476
(cherry picked from commit 8c7ca01ea7ee0943d5b3078b941c15932f6eecff)
"}]
commit_message:
Unquote URL before using splited parts.

Keystone EC2 access keys may contain URL reserved/unsafe chars,
then the access key in PATH_INFO can't be replace by account name.

ie.
  /v1/abc%3D/c/o  --> /v1/AUTH_PROJECT_ID/c/o

Change-Id: I034b0902f620cbb274647e24566dff2031beeae5
Closes-Bug: 1776476
(cherry picked from commit 8c7ca01ea7ee0943d5b3078b941c15932f6eecff)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/88/689888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Rocky Only] Fix upgrade_steps_tasks playbook generation.

In the backport [0] it was removed the loop that iterated
over each role to create the upgrade_steps_tasks playbook
and included the generation as part of the previous
secion (pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook) loop.
This causes the upgrade to stop working as upgrade_steps_
tasks will be build for only one role (the last we iterated
over in the previous loop) and running the upgrade for any
other role will end up in all the upgrade_tasks being
skipped.

[0] - I4ee0110a6c2b9466d81e37e5df27f5f81a6eceb5
Change-Id: Iff7308b544f73fa698b4e532ca64a3ace19905ef
Closes-Bug: #1848789

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-30 10:23:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d45b416cf7e0bd0d2aa7e23dd8b15c85d1dfa29f', 'message': 'VMware: ensure correct datastore usage when booting from volume

Make use of the cinder datastor when booting from a volume. There was
no need to relocate the volume from the cinder datastore to the nova one.
This breaks the cinder flavor selection.

commit_message:
VMware: ensure volume is accessible by instance

In general we need to make use of the cinder datastore when booting
from a volume. In the event that the instance is unable to acces the
volume as cinder may select a datastore that is not accesible by the
host (this is when storage policies are not used).

We need to ensure that the cinder volume type is honored. If and only
if the volume is not accesible then we should reolcate.

Co-Authored-By: chinmay <chinmaya-bharadwaj.a@hp.com>

Change-Id: I8fc60f0aac95b234a4cbf0ad9a6903f83036e70c
Closes-bug: #1490257
Closes-bug: #1469655

added_lines: mock_vo.attach_volume.side_effect = test.TestingException volumeops.attach_volume.assert_any_call( connection_info1, self._instance, self._vmops._volumeops.attach_volume) adapter_type)
deleted_lines: mock_vo.attach_root_volume.side_effect = test.TestingException volumeops.attach_root_volume.assert_called_once_with( connection_info1, self._instance, vi.datastore.ref, self._vmops._volumeops.attach_root_volume) self._ds.ref, adapter_type)

subject: Empty machine_id file causes get_sysinfo_serial_auto to fail.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 22:40:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b621b7ab0571b8da1ce7c0d9d8b3b8d7c62855ff', 'message': "If OS populated machine_id file is empty, use hardware serial for the libvirt driver.

Nova intends to treat absence of /etc/machine-id file same as the file being empty.
However, when sysinfo_serial option is set to 'auto', it only checks for presence of file and not whether id is present.
Fixing the auto serial function to use hardware serial if the OS serial function throws nova exception.

Change-Id: I27837c3da0eee4207717d50d5c3e3dba42326a39
Closes-Bug: 1584236
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-23 01:05:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/116414e673f475cec25b28f0f30eddd1580ec267', 'message': 'Empty machine_id file causes get_sysinfo_serial_auto to fail.

Nova intends to treat absence of /etc/machine-id file same as the file being empty.
So if /etc/machine_id file is empty, in auto mode, use hardware serial for the libvirt driver.
However, it currently only checks for presence of file and not whether id is present.
Fixing the auto_serial function to use hardware_serial if os_serial throws nova exception.

Change-Id: I27837c3da0eee4207717d50d5c3e3dba42326a39
Closes-Bug: 1584236
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-24 16:18:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1a7343c3e9c6dea3097bf3dfe015ce8a20e22c31', 'message': 'Empty machine_id file causes get_sysinfo_serial_auto to fail.

Currently Nova only checks /etc/machine-id existence and not whether
an actual id is present.

With this patch Nova treats absence of /etc/machine-id file same as

commit_message:
Empty machine_id file causes get_sysinfo_serial_auto to fail.

Currently Nova only checks /etc/machine-id existence and not whether
an actual id is present.

With this patch Nova treats absence of /etc/machine-id file same as
the file being empty. So if /etc/machine_id file is empty, in auto mode,
use hardware serial for the libvirt driver (changing the auto_serial
function to use hardware_serial() if os_serial() raises a NovaException).

Change-Id: I27837c3da0eee4207717d50d5c3e3dba42326a39
Closes-Bug: 1584236

commit_message:
assorted fixes in networking_bagpipe.bagpipe_bgp module

This change bundles two fixes for CI-breaking
bugs and which hence need to be pushed together.

bug #1846601 / Fix TypeError when calling join on bytes sequence

In bagpipe_bgp.common.run_command module output and error
of command are of type "bytes" instead of "string".
That causes some issues when it's running on Python 3.

So this patch fixes it by converting those variables always to
the string type.

bug #1846767 / Force copy of dict items in "for" loop

In module bagpipe_bgp.common.dataplane_utils in
ObjectLifecycleManager.clear_objects() method there is for loop
which iterates over items from dict.
To avoid changes of dict during iterations this patch forces always
to create list which is copy of items from dict.

Closes-Bug: #1846601
(cherry picked from commit 996ea4530433039ef41a3dcd82c48bba905480ad)
Closes-Bug: #1846767
(cherry picked from commit dbdbb2a92c6b64d9c521fdc9247fcaa342c7f1f9)

Change-Id: I39233176ab9a3fd221fdd3f1871d5b1fe0ca601d

commit_message:
Don't populate resources for not-yet-migrated inst

Per the referenced bug, it is possible for update_available_resource to
race with a migration such that the migration record exists, but the
instance's migration context doesn't. In such cases we shouldn't try to
track the instance's assigned resources on this host (because there
aren't any yet).

Change-Id: I69f99adfa8c91b50086052ca1b15c55e86ed614d
Closes-Bug: #1849165

commit_message:
Update Horizon Helm test to use python3

This change updates the tests container image
to one which installs python3.

The selenium-test.py template file has been refactored
to match the structure of the selenium tests in
openstack-helm-infra/tools/gate/selenium

commit_message:
Permit access to Ceph RGW for 'member' role

From the Rocky release, Keystone is bootstrapped by default [1]
with a 'member' role, while previously we used to create at
deployment time a role called 'Member'.

Role names are case insensitive in Keystone but Ceph RGW expects
a whitelist of role names to which access is permitted. This change
adds 'member' to the Ceph RGW whitelist, in addition to 'Member'.

1. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/basic-default-roles

Change-Id: Ib3c70c136fa4a03b58edc370343a01d657b5b101
Closes-Bug: 1847539
(cherry picked from commit 1357a131c83e0d4c699df5b9230c382a803eb5d7)
(cherry picked from commit 7ecd756b7c5eff4ef938fced335d75123749b1f3)

commit_message:
Ignore sqla-migrate inspect.getargspec deprecation warnings on py36

The 'message' argument is a regex so you need to escape brackets and the
likes. Strange that this worked on py27.

This was coincidentally fixed by Ib9f735216773224f91ac7f49fbe2eee119670872
in Train but this change is backportable while that one is not.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/fixtures.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Ib9f735216773224f91ac7f49fbe2eee119670872 in Stein, as
noted above.

Change-Id: Ia1f0fa6a46bdd0a87d40721937355b2cc887f1c9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1813147
(cherry picked from commit 79ee80d159e8be0d9f8215c2c5e210c545c551a7)

commit_message:
Use new shiny Devices class instead of old ugly Device

The pyudev library migrated teh Device class to Devices and
while all the old methods still work, it's marked for removal
in one of the next releases.
Updating to the new class will probably prevent some
headaches.

Change-Id: I4a4c7ce7b5139af9c8886a759979d5b3f5bf8b8d

commit_message:
Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejected by libvirt. We get these returned from libosinfo for
newer operating systems that support virtio1.0.

As we want to support libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request
"virtio", please see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400
(cherry picked from commit 6be668e51992df53a4d871bea70bc738a9beacb8)
(cherry picked from commit a06922d546a26c9e6550a93cbe0718cf841b6b9f)

commit_message:
Ensure pagination marker is always set

Previously the pagination marker was not being set for list
queries where `uuid` was not in the list of requested fields.
The affected endpoints were: port, portgroup, volume_target,
volume_connector, node and chassis.

The next marker contains the UUID of the last element that
was returned to the client. This information was being
removed from elements in the collection. This meant that we
could no longer return a UUID for this marker. An extra
parameter, `sanitize` was added to `convert_with_links`.
This allows us to delay stripping this field from the
elements until after the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/587514/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with port list queries where the next marker was not being set if ``uuid`` was not in the list of requested fields. `See story 2003192 for more details <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003192>`_.

commit_message:
Use client architecture and set bootfile-url for DHCPv6 in inspector

For DHCPv6 PXE boot, the Client Architecture option uses code 61,
see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5970#section-3.3. Use this
to determine if booting over EFI and set the DHCPv6 bootfile-url
when booting PXE over EFI.

Change-Id: I096ac412c015c3ac488d712010aafe52b572cfad
(cherry picked from commit 3af894300266428ba3daa243d579680f583c7e96)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/23/689723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix the stable/queens branch to work with Ceilometer Queens

The development on Ceilosca skipped from Pike to Queens.
This is an attempt to fill in that gap.

Much of the change to remove the Ceilometer API related
functionality has been backported from stable/rocky.
Includes a minor backport of Python 3 support.

Change-Id: I053fa632e0f5b2473fd080c07520f00c1eef8016
Story: 2006709
Task: 37069

commit_message:
fix session cert arguments

All calls to the deprecated ironic commands are failing because
unsupported cert arguments are being used to create the session
(cafile, certfile, keyfile)

This change switches to using the correct arguments. It is proposed
first on stable/stein because the deprecated ironic commands were
removed in Train.

Change-Id: If0730c0d9c1c3a700cbc6ae16b1c3752d0b681c4
Story: 2006748
Task: 37230

subject: Fix issues building PDF docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-16 20:31:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8883ada26119cf1a2b7b31c9f92b49c8b9dbd2ce', 'message': "WIP: sphinx latex build tests

* Svg2pdf to fix svg image inclusion
* The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds tex's
  memory limit.  Produces this error:
    TeX capacity exceeded, sorry [main memory size=5000000].
  Potential solutions:
  * increase limit (this works, but it's a sudo task so will limit
    local build reproducibility)
  * break up includes?
  * do more research into other options
* The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard latex.
  However, sphinx provides an override setting.  Here I've set it
  to 10.
  * Also look into using the enumitem package.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-21 21:14:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/configuration/sample-config.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f58da25f3984b84b436bdea54d6227c9a76cf95f', 'message': "Fix issues building PDF docs

This fixes errors that occur when building PDF versions of the
docs.

svg2pdf is added as a docs dependency because the SVG images
can not be included in PDFs natively.

The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds TeX's
memory limit in most environments.  To avoid this, we omit
this from PDF builds, but retain it in HTML builds.  In the
future, folks may wish to explore breaking the config file into
smaller sections which would solve this problem and potentially
improve the readability in the HTML form.

The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard LaTeX.
However, Sphinx provides an override setting.  Here it is set
to 10 which is more than necessary for the current level of
nesting.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues building PDF docs

This fixes errors that occur when building PDF versions of the
docs.

svg2pdf is added as a docs dependency because the SVG images
can not be included in PDFs natively.

The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds TeX's
memory limit in most environments.  To avoid this, we omit
this from PDF builds, but retain it in HTML builds.  In the
future, folks may wish to explore breaking the config file into
smaller sections which would solve this problem and potentially
improve the readability in the HTML form.

The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard LaTeX.
However, Sphinx provides an override setting.  Here it is set
to 10 which is more than necessary for the current level of
nesting.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/677028/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I859e64f8c469eb8b02af09be7ce4753e41084251

commit_message:
Fix Molecule tests

Molecule tests using our custom modules were failing due to the lack of
yaml lib. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I859e64f8c469eb8b02af09be7ce4753e41084251
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9991eb2d64961535494ab6b38f9bb8e8dbaad12d)

commit_message:
Func: bug 1849165: mig race with _populate_assigned_resources

Add a functional regression test for the referenced bug:

If a migration is initiated, and update_available_resource runs on the
destination between when the migration record is associated with the
destination and when the migration context is added to the instance, it
will raise a TypeError attempting to _populate_assigned_resources for
that instance, because that method attempts to access the
(as-yet-nonexistent) migration context.

Note that this doesn't fail the migration; it just leaves ugly logs. In
real life it probably also leaves other pieces of
update_available_resource unfinished on the destination.

Related-Bug: #1849165
Change-Id: I7e96cd24049c205f76a684a2e7425f85b4376f73

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock import nova from nova import exception from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers class UpdateResourceMigrationRaceTest( integrated_helpers.ProviderUsageBaseTestCase): compute_driver = 'fake.SmallFakeDriver' def setUp(self): super(UpdateResourceMigrationRaceTest, self).setUp() self._start_compute(host="host1") self._start_compute(host="host2") flavors = self.api.get_flavors() self.flavor1 = flavors[0] def test_update_dest_between_mig_start_and_claim(self): """Validate update_available_resource when an instance exists that has started migrating but not yet been claimed on the destination. """ server = self._boot_and_check_allocations( self.flavor1, 'host1') orig_prep = nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._prep_resize def fake_prep(*args, **kwargs): # Trigger update_available_resource on the destination (this runs # it on the source as well, but that's okay). self._run_periodics() return orig_prep(*args, **kwargs) with mock.patch( 'nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._prep_resize', new=fake_prep): # Migrate the server. self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], {'migrate': None}) self._wait_for_server_parameter( self.api, server, { 'OS-EXT-STS:task_state': None, 'status': 'VERIFY_RESIZE'}) # FIXME(efried): This is bug 1849165 where # _populate_assigned_resources raises a TypeError because it tries # to access the instance's migration_context before that exists. self.assertIn( "TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable", self.stdlog.logger.output)
